message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about electrical circuits. As the current passes through the connections, they may experience resistance, which can cause them to get warm. Option (A) is unrelated to the electrical circuit. Option (C) is incorrect because the light is on when the circuit is closed. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no mention of the light being broken.

This flow of electricity can cause the connections to heat up. Option (A) is unrelated as the age of the house does not affect the circuit. Option (C) is incorrect because when the circuit is closed, the light should be on. Option (D) is also incorrect because if the light is broken, it would not turn on when the circuit is closed.
